attributes.action: HELP TO STOP the Hoo New Routes to Good Growth - Higham Road Phase 1

HELP STOP THESE WORKS!
attributes.additional_details: We echo Kelly Tolhurst comments (Member of Parliment) "it is important that we continue to come together as a community to fight proposals that will only damage the fabric and environment of our area and strain our local infrastructure and services" These plans are increasing stress and mental health for all residents. COVID is still present these works must be stopped. Safety and the wellbeing of local residents must be priority, these plans are not safe for any residents or pedestrians!

attributes.action: Ban All Single-Use Plastic Bags in the UK
attributes.background: It’s estimated that by the year 2050 there will be more plastic in the oceans than fish. Most single use plastic bags are non-recyclable and will end up in our environment as well as our oceans, polluting and ruining the ocean’s ecosystems. We want the Government to ban all single use plastic bags.
attributes.additional_details:
By banning the single use plastic bag, the UK can send a powerful message that it can be a global environmental leader and inspire other countries to follow our lead. Retailers should offer recycled paper bags for 10p fee or offer reusable bags made out of sustainable materials such as hemp, linen, bamboo, etc. 

Please sign the petition and once you are done share it with everyone you know who cares about the environment and their future on this planet.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Ban plastic bags in supermarkets, and other retail shops: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328310

Ban plastic bags for online supermarket deliveries: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549991

attributes.action: Support British Wool farmers and products made from British Wool in the UK
attributes.background:
Make it easier to purchase products made from British Wool in the UK with clearer labelling and promotion of natural fibres.
Take a stand and be far more vocal in support of natural fibres, with particular reference to British Wool.
Ensure that products are labelled clearly with place of origin.
attributes.additional_details:
British Wool is a very underused product of the UK farming industry. The prices for raw fleeces at present are below the costs of shearing and transportation to the Wool Marketing Board collection sites. Many farmers are burning their fleeces in the fields.
The use of products made from acrylic and polyester fibre are causing microparticles to pollute the whole planet. An active support for businesses who use British fleece for their products would be an huge financial and environmental help.

rejection.details:
You want the Government to 'take a stand and be far more vocal in support of natural fibres' but you don't specify what you mean by that.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to introduce tax incentives for clothing manufacturers which prioritise the use of textiles grown in the UK, if that is something you'd like to happen. 

You may also like to sign this petition which calls for 'All products sold in the UK to be clearly labelled with country of origin': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309019

attributes.action:
Ban Bonfires excluding bonfire night.
Ban fireworks excluding firework night.
attributes.background:
BAN BONFIRES EXCLUDING BONFIRE NIGHT
BAN FIREWORKS EXCLUDING FIREWORK NIGHT
attributes.additional_details:
Bonfires around our area can start as early as 8am any day and in evening after 11pm, its not fair, its pollution, causing more usage of water to rewash my things, have to close all windows even if hot, we should not be controlled when we can and cant leave our windows open for air!
Fireworks scare so many animals and go off throughout the year, and children have access to them via houses as you see random few go off!!

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319891

attributes.action: Stop dangerous pollution from poultry farms along the Wye and its tributaries.
attributes.background: Intensive poultry units (IPUs) along the River Wye and its tributaries are turning it into a wildlife deathtrap and causing untold damage to one of Britain’s best loved rivers. Runoff from IPUs causes the spread of algal blooms that devastate the river’s ecosystem and turn the water a murky green.
attributes.additional_details: Take long-term strategic action to ensure that the UK poultry industry is environmentally sound, through effective delivery of the Environment Act, Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017, the Well-Being of Future Generations Act and the Water Framework Directive. Conduct urgent research, regulate and monitor IPUs and enforce LPA planning conditions. Regulate the poultry industry and hold it to account for breach of environmental responsibility. Publish public reports on progress.

rejection.details:
Your petition appears to relate to activities in Wales, and planning and the environment are devolved matters, so the responsibility of the Welsh Government, Welsh local authorities and Natural Resources Wales, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You can petition the Welsh Parliament here: https://petitions.senedd.wales/

attributes.action: Look forward for the environment rather than going back to normalised life
attributes.background: I want the government to look at safer and better ways to treat the earth after the spread of the virus rather than going back to a normal way of living. Since the spread of co-vid 19 pollution in the air has decreased and the oceans are clearing.Example : More at home jobs - less travel pollution
attributes.additional_details:
I want them to do this not only for our generation but for the other generations to come. The earth is our home and we need to treat it with respect - We look after the world and it looks after us. 

By an easy search on the internet you can see the positive effect that this has had on the world. Clearer sky's in China - clearer seas (everywhere) - Not only does it effect the human race but the animals too

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Parliament or Government to take a specific action. We understand that you're concerned about the environment, but we're not sure exactly what you want the UK Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Start using eco-friendly methods of transport to deliver food in city centres
attributes.background: introduce a law that stops takeaways and restaurants from using cars and mopeds as a means of delivering food within a radius to the town center. Pollution is damaging the country and if we start cutting down how much pollution is spread then we are saving the future generation.
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to do it because not only is this saving the environment but it is a smart strategic move because if we can start of small then imagine the greater cause, it will boost revenue as there are a lot of start-up companies that can benefit from this move.

attributes.action: Nationalise Water Companies for the future benefit of generations to come.
attributes.background: Take back all water supplies into public ownership.
attributes.additional_details: The water industry has taken £72 billion from households and businesses, yet all our rivers are unfit, and polluted. Our beaches are surrounded by sewage-contaminated water due to effluent being discharged. Water companies operate to create profit for shareholders, not to benefit the people. Standards are appalling. We, the people, need one national company owned by the nation to implement a standardised policy to clean our rivers and seas and to provide safe water for everyone.

Renationalise water

attributes.action: Call an early general election
attributes.background: Liz Truss should call for a general election so that the citizens of the United Kingdom can choose their leader in these unprecedented times.
attributes.additional_details:
Liz Truss was not elected by the UK public and the people need to choose who will lead them in these unprecedented times.

Inflation is at the highest level in 40 years with no clear plan on how to address the cost-of-living crisis.

Oil and gas giants are expecting profits of £170bn whilst families will have to choose between eating or feeding their families. 

British waters are covered in raw sewage with no penalties on private companies polluting our waters but in fact getting tax cuts.

If a Prime Minister resigns a general election should be called

attributes.action: RESTRICT THE USE OF FIREWORKS SO THEY ARE ONLY USED BONFIRE NIGHT AND NEW YEARS
attributes.background:
Stop the use of fireworks for birthdays, weddings etc
To let Fireworks only be used at relevant times of the year for BONFIRE night and NEW YEARS EVE only.
attributes.additional_details:
Even with their ephemeral nature, fireworks cause a lot of air pollution in a very short amount of time. ... A scientist told Forbes that when the fireworks go off, the metal salts and explosives undergo a chemical reaction that releases smoke and gases into the air.  As we are fighting to protect our ozone I feel that fireworks are adding to the problem of air pollution.
They only used to be used bonfire night and from 2000 new years eve.
It is also causing great stress to pets at home.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/595560

attributes.action: 5 Year Ban and from National Parks and unlimited fine if you're caught littering
attributes.background:
If caught littering in a national park you should receive a 5 year ban.
You can reduce this sentence by performing community service cleaning a national park or choose it over a fine.
Trespass after offence should be added to criminal record, offender then needing to wear a tag to prevent trespass
attributes.additional_details: Litter is killing our wildlife, polluting our waters and damaging our ecosystems, in areas of outstanding beauty people are damaging them and it must be taken seriously, offenders don't deserve to get away with this and should be expelled from these areas if caught and forced to clean them, it's disgusting and these people should be forced to repair the damage that they have committed to the environment.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about banning someone from a national park or parks would be a matter for the relevant parks authority, not the Government or House of Commons. As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase fixed penalty fines for littering: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581996

Mandatory community service for litter droppers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577555

attributes.action: Give the stolen marbles / sculptures back to Greece.
attributes.background: Those marbles were stolen from The Parthenon in Athens, when Greece was under the Turkish occupation and the Turkish leader gave permission to Lord Elgin to take them. Unlawful. The British Museum says they store them to avoid them being affected by pollution. London has more pollution than Athens.
attributes.additional_details:
Year after year after year, Greek people and celebrities ask for the marbles to be returned. 

The U.K. government had said that they would give us the marbles back if we had a new, better suited museum to store them in. This, in Greece now we have a new Acropolis museum. 

They were given to the U.K. unlawfully and the British Museum is still storing them under false pretences (to save them from pollution). 

They are part of our history and culture and all of us (Greek people) want them back.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Legalise the use of  E-scooters and E-bikes for adults.
attributes.background:
Legalise the use of privately owned e-bikes/e-scooters for over 18s who have a driving licence and insurance.
These should be allowed to be used on cycle lanes and roads with a speed limit of 30 miles per hour or less.
Scooters could be allowed on pavements where there is no danger to pedestrians.
attributes.additional_details:
This will help avoid traffic congestion and help with the prevention of air pollution. It is better for the environment. 
The e-scooters are safer than the average bicycle because they are slower and easier to stop in an emergency. 
But I do not believe anyone under the age of 18 should be allowed to use either. They need to be classified as a form of transport and not toys.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332067

attributes.action: Review the rates of vehicle tax charged on motorbikes, with a view to reduce.
attributes.background: Motorbikes are not currently tested for emissions, unlike cars, but seem to be taxed at a high rate, & are not big polluters. I am not sure how the current level of tax was established, but it seems very high when compared to cars. I would like to see a reduction based on polution levels.
attributes.additional_details: I own a motorbike over 600cc, & the tax cost is £93 pa. I own a 1.5 diesel car that is £30 pa tax. My son has a 1200cc petrol car that is £30pa tax. There does seem to be a mismatch here!!  As motorbikes are not tested for emissions, how were these rates set? Have they ever been reviewed? I would suggest the sulution is to test a range of different cc bikes & see what the actual polution rates are, & then reduce the banded rates accordingly. I would be very interested to see the results.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333461

attributes.action: Ban face masks
attributes.background: Ban the use of face masks due them being improperly worn & irresponsibly disposed of.
attributes.additional_details: There is an ever increasing amount of face masks being improperly worn & irresponsibly disposed of on the floor which make their way into rivers & our seas polluting them & the wildlife there. It is not only an unsightly mess but a health hazard & potential environmental catastrophe waiting to happen. They are causing more harm than good & we have a moral duty not just to fellow human beings but other living inhabitants of this planet which we share.  Urgent action is needed. #BanTheMask

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549832

If you want the Government to ban all face masks, you could start a new petition requesting this.

attributes.action: Require drive-thru takeaways to write customer vehicle reg numbers on packaging.
attributes.background: Litter from fast food and coffee drive-thru takeaways is blighting our urban and rural landscapes. Voluntary measures have failed. An effective solution would be to require businesses to write customer vehicle registration numbers on packaging, forcing people to dispose of their rubbish responsibly.
attributes.additional_details: During the coronavirus lockdown, litter from fast food outlets all but disappeared. But with the easing of restrictions, discarded fast food packaging has begun to increase on roadsides and at beauty spots, causing plastic pollution and draining the public purse. Councils and Highways England spend nearly £700m a year cleaning up litter. The Government could reduce this cost by introducing a requirement for vehicle registrations to be recorded on all drive-thru takeaway packaging.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324517

attributes.action: Forbid trading to non essential business & services on Sundays.
attributes.background:
Our main concern is the effects on the environment but also we want society to restore their spiritual values and to have peace of mind. 

We should take the lesson of the coronavirus epidemic as an example of the benefits of having less people on the streets as this reduces pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
It is important to reduce pollution and there's no question about it. These days people can buy online so why do we need more people on the streets on Sundays.

Less shops means: less cars, trains, energy consumption, rubbish, noise, etc. This will allow the air to clean and nature to flourish better. 

This would also reduce accidents and the need for more police on the and emergency services on the streets. 

This would help to reduce stress on society.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310336

attributes.action: Ban Fracking in Lancashire (and Nationwide)
attributes.background: To vote against fracking in the UK to uphold our country's commitment to the global fight against climate change and prevent the environmental disasters caused by fracking in other countries from occurring in our country; preserving our beautiful rural areas, its wilderness and biodiversity.
attributes.additional_details: Earlier in Liz Truss's premiership she stated that fracking would go ahead in areas as long as there is local support; as a constituent of Blackpool I can categorically state that there has already been passionate resistance to previous attempts to frack in the area. Fracking cause tremors which are a threat to peoples houses and livelihoods as seen elsewhere in the world, furthermore, fracking also disrupts and displaces wildlife due to noise pollution and the destruction of natural habitats.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastic bottles in the manufacture of soft drinks for UK market
attributes.background:
We want the Government to take action to cut down plastic pollution by banning single-use plastic bottles in the manufacture of soft drinks in the UK. 
We say planet before profits and support us in telling the Government to take action today, ban the use of plastic bottles for soft drinks.
attributes.additional_details:
We are here to shout at the top of our lungs “End the OBSESSION with plastic bottles. Let’s stop choking up our oceans, and clogging our beaches and landfills with this unnecessary type of plastic bottle”

The UK Government must ban the use of harmful plastic bottles in soft drinks. 

You ask what does this mean for our favourite soft drinks? It means companies need to take a green approach to their manufacturing process, and put our planet before their shareholders profits!

attributes.action: Move the Portsmouth Clean Air Zone boundary
attributes.background: Allow the Isle of Wight Wightlink ferry traffic an exit from the Portsmouth Terminal that can avoid the clean air zone, all other docks/ports have been excluded from the clean air zone.
attributes.additional_details:
The island is already disadvantaged, so a £50 a day charge is excessive when islanders are not given an alternative route.
The use of other ferry routes would create more pollution due to extra unnecessary drive time.

rejection.details:
Decisions about local clean air zones are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, ZEZ and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618266

attributes.action: Restore the Fracking Ban
attributes.background:
The fracking ban was lifted on 22nd September against the wishes of many communities and without addressing the concerns about earth tremors and other issues.
There's no democratic mandate for lifting the ban wasn't in the last Conservative manifesto and it hasn't been approved by Parliament.
attributes.additional_details:
It'll take years for the fracking industry to develop and become economically viable if ever so it won't address the current cost of living crisis.
A large scale fracking industry will destroy swathes of our countryside that we need for growing food, for wildlife and our own wellbeing. 
Instead, we need to focus on developing renewable energy rather than fossil fuels that will pollute the planet and eventually run out.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Keep The Fracking Ban
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

attributes.action: Halt or delay the 2023 ULEZ expansion
attributes.background: Half the expansion of the ULEZ zone to rural areas that do not suffer air pollution. A good portion of the impacted population live in rural areas and drive efficient (60+mpg) cars short distance (under 10k miles per year). This is a big financial blow with minimal improvements for the environment.
attributes.additional_details: With the pandemic having an impact on all of us financially and on our health, supply chain issues with car prices up, the rising living costs, the war, this is needlessly punitive and poorly timed measure.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the issue you raise is not the responsibility of the Government or Parliament. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Revoke local government powers to charge CAZ, LEZ, ZEZ and ULEZ: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618266

attributes.action: Save the Upper Nene Valley countryside from massive industrialisation.
attributes.background:
Stop the large number of distribution centres currently being planned on good agricultural land within the Upper Nene Valley.

Ensure speculative developers are not allowed to exploit budget constrained councils into permitting inappropriate and unsustainable development for short term profit.
attributes.additional_details:
Villages and towns in this beautiful rural area are becoming inundated with large ugly warehouses and more are being planned.

The increase in heavy goods vehicles and subsequent air, noise and light pollution will result in a reduction in the quality of life for all residents in the Upper Nene Valley.

Increased industrialization will contribute to global warming, flooding and climate change.

This loss of countryside will reduce the diversity of plants, animals and birds, never to be regained.

rejection.details:
Local planning decisions within the Upper Nene Valley are a matter for the individual local authority, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

If you are concerned about planning decisions in your area you could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Also driving a e scooter it’s a green solution against the global pollution problem that caused more deaths by time

attributes.action: Stop the national reduction of speed limits as a means to reduce pollution.
attributes.background: Motivate businesses to encourage all employees where it is practical to do so, to work from home.
attributes.additional_details:
The Covid-19 pandemic has shown that technology is available to work effectively from any location with a broadband connection. Technology can be used to reduce our national carbon footprint by changing our traditional habit of committing to and from a place of work.

This approach will provide more time for individuals and families, reduce congestion as well as reduce emissions by removing vehicles from our roads. In addition this will also make cycling on the road safer.

attributes.action: Remove single use plastic bags from supermarkets
attributes.background: The current cost of single use plastic bags in supermarkets is too low to deter the majority of customers from purchasing them. Remove the the option of purchasing single use plastic bags for 10p. Instead only sell multi-use bag options such as 'bags for life' for a minimum of £1.
attributes.additional_details: The current volumes of plastic waste in our oceans and environment is shocking and is only increasing. Single use plastic bags from supermarkets directly contribute to plastic pollution which could be easily avoided. We need to act now before it's too late. By only having the higher price £1 multi-use bag options, customers will be more likely to remember to bring a bag instead of purchasing new ones each time.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581139

attributes.action: Ban fipronil and imidacloprid from pet flea products as they kill river insects
attributes.background: One flea treatment contains enough pesticide to kill 60 million bees! The washing of pets flushes chemicals into rivers, while dogs swimming is another pathway for contamination. Rivers are being polluted. The government is requested to ban the use of these products in all pet flea treatments.
attributes.additional_details: Almost 4,000 samples recently gathered by the Environment Agency in 20 English rivers showed Fipronil was detected in 99% of samples and a highly toxic breakdown product called fipronil sulfone was found in 97%. The average concentrations were 5 and 38 times higher than their chronic toxicity limits, respectively. Imidacloprid was found in 66% of the samples and was above toxicity limits in seven of the 20 rivers.  Many pets are treated every month, whether needed or not.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560905

attributes.action: Give food companies a year to reduce their plastic packaging by at least 50%.
attributes.background:
Put pressure on food companies especially those who sell to supermarkets to reduce their plastic packaging.
Single use plastic is damaging the environment and wildlife. Alternatives like paper can be easily used.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment citizens are responsible for being the “demand” for products meaning we’re being blamed for choosing products with high plastic content. However there is not much of a choice when everything you find in the supermarket is covered in single use plastic polluting the world.

attributes.additional_details: Barbecues sold most frequently in supermarkets in tin trays have become a nuisance.  They cause polluting smoke on busy beaches. They are a significant cause of litter.  Often left buried on beaches causing a serious burn hazard if walked over in bare feet. Fire hazard on heaths and commons.  Fire ha,ard in municipal litter bins.  Altogether anti-social and potentially dangerous.

attributes.action: Add 999 years to 2026 deadline for registering existence of public footpaths.
attributes.background: Change the Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000 by extending deadline by 999 years to allow time for people to record thousands of miles of public footpaths and rights of way that are in current use and may be lost to generations of people whose footsteps laid claim to the right of access.
attributes.additional_details:
Public footpaths not claimed by 2026 will lose public right of access.

Accessing much loved and cherished public footpaths is vital to people wishing to escape the confines of urban life, air pollution, the drudgery of life and, to keep fit. 

The global pandemic, projected population increase, and widespread reported obesity figures provide incentive for preserving access to public footpaths and rights of way by default in perpetuity.

attributes.action: Stop making face masks mandatory in shops.
attributes.background: It is the people's right to breathe fresh air, not polluted air from germs/ bacteria being recycled back in the body from a mask, or the lack of oxygen which is vital to overall health and functioning.  It is our bodies and we should choose what we do with our own body.
attributes.additional_details: Wearing a mask will increase CO2 in the body and decrease O2 = Oxygen. Less oxygen can only mean more sickness. We do not need more sickness from this and all you are doing by introducing masks is bringing in more vulnerability, which could be avoided. Law can only be created with the consent of the population, according to the magna carta. This should not be mandatory, as it takes away an individuals sovereign right in deciding what is best for their own health and well being.

attributes.action: Subject all mature trees to Tree Preservation Orders.
attributes.background: We need protection of all mature trees, as afforded to those in conservation areas, ensured in response to the Government declared Climate Emergency 1st May 2019. Mature trees are being removed without environmentally commensurate replacement, and with the life sustained by the tree already lost.
attributes.additional_details:
Trees store carbon and give us oxygen, vital for life. 
They provide habitat for wildlife and support biodiversity. 
In urban areas they reduce noise and capture pollutants from the air we breathe. They provide soil stability and reduce stormwater runoff, crucial for flood management. Trees provide shelter from wind and sun, and actively cool the surrounding air as well as enhancing our lives, giving us a sense of beauty and well being.

The right time to plant a tree is many decades ago.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300050

attributes.action: Compulsory Domestic Rainwater Collection for all New build homes
attributes.background:
Joined Up thinking by Planning Authorities

Produce guidance or statute to ensure that Planning Authorities require all new homes built in the UK to require inclusion of an appropriately sized rainwater collection system and associated Grey water supply to WC's and other non-potable connections.
attributes.additional_details:
Thousands of new houses increase demand for treated water and sewerage.

Climate Change means bigger, more frequent storms and more FLOODING.

If every new home included a rainwater collection system then:

1. Reduced need to spend £Billions to enlarge sewers
2. Prevent inundation of Water Treatment Works, reducing the number of raw sewerage discharges to rivers and sea. [HoL: Sewage pollution in England’s waters, 30 June, 2022]
4.  Reduce treated water demand
5. Reduce the risk of flooding

attributes.action: Add a tax onto the use of carbon

Create an additional tax onto every 2 metric tons used by appliances (similar to sugar tax).
Climate Change is a monumental problem that needs addressing. By adding a small tax onto the price of carbon allows people to be more mindful of how freely they use appliances that include the use of carbon
attributes.additional_details: it is shown that 67% of pollution is caused by carbon emissions being pumped into the air by daily devices. By reducing the use of carbon it allows to find a more positive, earth- friendly alternative to allow the O-zone to heal

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see new taxes on appliances that contribute to carbon emissions, but we're not sure if you want these to be applied based on the carbon cost of manufacturing appliances, or the carbon cost of using appliances.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

Noise pollution

attributes.action: Limit the Sale and Use of Fireworks to Organisers of Licensed Displays Only
attributes.background: limiting their sale & use to licensed displays only is necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Restrictions on the sale & use of fireworks has huge public support and is backed by several human and animal charities. Limiting the sale & use of fireworks to displays only, by introducing licensing via local authorities, would help to protect vulnerable people and animals from the distress and anxiety caused by unexpected firework noise & pollution. Legislation that balances people’s desires for firework displays, and individual rights to not be distressed throughout the year, is needed now.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616868

attributes.action: Action to address soaring energy costs, consumption and supply issues.
attributes.background:
1) Review the need for the street lights between 9pm and 6am. Pass any savings on to domestic dwellings, and reduce light pollution too.

2) Pump prime renewable energies.  Nationalise the manufacturing and fitting of modern solar harvesting roof tiles which look like normal roof tiles.
attributes.additional_details:
Re-opening coal reserves isn’t sustainable or environmentally friendly.

The governments plans, even if worst case scenario, for reduced commercial/industrial supply and even domestic blackouts should not be acceptable.

rejection.details:
Decisions about street lighting are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to take action in relation to the means of production of solar panels, or you might like to sign the following petitions, which makes a related request:

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Create new publicly owned solar energy company to address fuel & climate crisis: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611416

attributes.action: Set income tax to 1% Overhaul UK taxation system
attributes.background:
Impose a compulsory social contribution, on every financial transaction within the UK providing cash to the treasury taxing the same money over and again
To control of the economy add a surcharge to the relevant sector. Alcohol tobacco energy. surcharge pollutants, fossil fuels zero on renewables.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see changes to the UK tax system, but we're not sure exactly what changes you'd like the Government or Parliament to make.

Your petition refers to a "compulsory social contribution", but it's not clear how you want this to work. We're also not sure what you mean when you refer to "surcharges" for certain sectors.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: We request a change in the legislation relating to dredged material.
attributes.background: Bring into UK law a clear framework for the regulation and control of dredging. To set out safe systems and controls to cover all dredging activities. The decontamination and safe disposal on land of all dredged materials. Substantial fines to be imposed for breaches of the regulations.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there are no regulations stopping dredged sediment being dumped into the sea. We have over 100 years of industrial pollution that has settled in the deep sediment of many of our industrial rivers. 
The toxic sediment is currently allowed to be dumped out to sea, risking an environmental catastrophe which effects a wide range of sea life and a health risk to human life.
At this time of a climate emergency we can take no chances with the health of our oceans.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the disposal of dredged material at sea. However the disposal of such material at sea is already regulated by the Marine Management Organisation, which has the power to license such disposals and impose fines for breaches of the Marine and Coastal Access Act 2009. You can read this Act here: https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2009/23/contents.

It's therefore not clear how the regulation you want would be different from what is already in place.  

You could have a petition calling for these regulations to be changed in some specific way, so long as it was clear from the petition what these changes were.

attributes.action: Ban the use of all single-use plastics; such as cups, packaging, and bags.
attributes.background: Instil a firm ban on all single-use plastics and polystyrene. The UK is a first-world country and has the resources to become more environmentally friendly as a society, this ban is the first step.
attributes.additional_details: The world is in the midst of an escalating climate crisis. The continuous supply of non-recyclable, single-use items, such as plastic cups at a water fountain or plastic bags used to carry groceries, damages the atmosphere from manufacturing emissions, fills space in landfills, and kills animals from pollution on both land and in the sea. Instilling this ban will not only raise awareness about the global climate crisis but it will also lead a strong trajectory to a more eco-friendly Britain.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Ban All Single Use Plastics and Plastic Packaging to Save Our Planet
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607466

We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Suspend major development applications on green belt and protected land: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616891

attributes.action: Introduce that at least 25% of all clothes in the UK are made from British wool.
attributes.background: Ensure that wool from British farms is used to create domestically produced clothing. This would help reduce pollution from plastics which is e.g. linked to micro fibres from synthetic fleece garments. It would also mean that clothing is biodegradable and more environmentally friendly overall.
attributes.additional_details: Using wool produced in the UK would help develop the textile industry. Develop a new high quality textile industry would also provide jobs and opportunities for skilled workers. It would raise the price wool which of an undervalued commodity. Help create longer lasting clothing which will reduce waste. Provide sheep farmers with an income that does not rely on subsidies.

rejection.details:
Decisions on which materials are used in the manufacturing of clothes are a matter for manufacturers and retailers, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could have a petition calling on the Government to ban the sale of clothes containing wool sourced from outside the UK, if that is something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Make multi-layer material consumer food packaging compostable by 2030 in the UK
attributes.background: Parliament must vote to make mixed material consumer food packaging in the UK compostable and a legal requirement by 2030. Multi-layer material packaging e.g. crisp packets must use compostable or single material packaging. Goods that do not meet these regulations by 2030 will be taxed.
attributes.additional_details: The UK can set the example, leading change in the global market using our consumer power. Producers must adapt to a changing world, and shift to working under a circular economy. This legislation can begin this change. Although supplementary, we must look past recycling to instead reduce the use of plastic, reverse waste pollution and the growing damage of micro plastics. Our consumption can be reformed and this ambition to reduce our plastic production can be realised with this call for change.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see new requirements for certain types of food packaging, but it's not clear if you want all such packaging to be recyclable, or made of a single material, or something else.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

As stated E10 fuel has sufficient evidence that it produces less harmful gasses to pollute the environment, that said this should reflect on petrol vehicle owners road tax yearly.
